content: is there such a thing as  blog post: how to recover neo4j db from transaction log?

Yes, there are blog posts and resources available that discuss how to recover a Neo4j database from the transaction log. Here are a few examples:

1. "Performing a Neo4j Recovery": This blog post on the official Neo4j blog provides a step-by-step guide on how to recover a database from the transaction log. It covers scenarios such as unexpected shutdowns, corrupted data, and restoring to a specific point in time. You can find it at: https://neo4j.com/blog/performing-a-neo4j-recovery/

2. "How to Recover a Neo4j Database from Transaction Logs": This tutorial on Medium explains the process of recovering a Neo4j database using the transaction logs. It includes detailed instructions, code snippets, and explanations of the various steps involved. You can locate it here: https://medium.com/@sam.hapgood/how-to-recover-a-neo4j-database-from-transaction-logs-ae2df2e456a8

3. "Recovering Neo4j Data from Transaction Logs": Neo4j's official documentation also provides information on recovering data from transaction logs. This resource covers the concepts and methods used for recovery, including restoring from backups and replaying transaction logs. You can access it at: https://neo4j.com/docs/operations-manual/current/recovery/

These blog posts and resources should give you a good starting point in understanding how to recover a Neo4j database from its transaction log. Remember to follow the instructions carefully and make backups before attempting any recovery operations.
